Package de.ikor.sip.foundation.core.declarative.connector

Interface ConnectorDefinition

All Superinterfaces:
Orchestratable<ConnectorOrchestrationInfo>
All Known Subinterfaces:
InboundConnectorDefinition<T>, OutboundConnectorDefinition
All Known Implementing Classes:
ConnectorBase, GenericInboundConnectorBase, GenericOutboundConnectorBase, InboundConnectorBase, RestInboundConnectorBase, SoapOperationInboundConnectorBase, SoapOperationOutboundConnectorBase
public sealed interface ConnectorDefinition extends Orchestratable<ConnectorOrchestrationInfo> permits ConnectorBase, InboundConnectorDefinition<T>, OutboundConnectorDefinition
Common definition interface for specifying connectors used within a SIP adapter.

A connector is responsible for defining the endpoints for communication with external systems, as well as transforming the request- and response-models between the external system's domain and the integration scenario's common domain model.

Adapter developers should not implement this interface directly, but use one of the more specific InboundConnectorDefinition or OutboundConnectorDefinition interfaces instead.

See Also:
  • InboundConnectorDefinition
  • OutboundConnectorDefinition

  • Method Details

    • getId

      String getId()
      Returns the ID of the connector. Must be unique within the scope of the adapter.
      Returns:
      Unique connector identifier

    • getConnectorType

      ConnectorType getConnectorType()
      Returns the type of the connector.
      Returns:
      Connector type

    • getConnectorGroupId

      String getConnectorGroupId()
      Returns the ID of the connector group this connector belongs to.
      Returns:
      ID of the connector group
      See Also:
      • ConnectorGroupDefinition

      String getScenarioId()
      Returns the ID of the integration scenario this connector belongs to.
      Returns:
      ID of the integration scenario
      See Also:
      • IntegrationScenarioDefinition

    • getRequestModelClass

      Class<?> getRequestModelClass()
      Returns the base class of the request model used by the connector. This is the request model that is used by the adapter to communicate with the external system.
      Returns:
      Request model base class

    • hasResponseFlow

      default boolean hasResponseFlow()
      Returns whether this connector has a response flow in the connected scenario. The default implementation returns true if getResponseModelClass() returns a non-empty Optional.
      Returns:
      true if the connector has a response flow, false otherwise

    • getResponseModelClass

      Optional<Class<?>> getResponseModelClass()
      Returns the base class of the response model used by the connector. This is the response model that is used by the adapter to communicate with the external system.
      Returns:
      Response model base class, or an empty Optional if the connector does not have a response flow

    • getPathToDocumentationResource

      String getPathToDocumentationResource()
      Returns the path to the documentation resource for this connector. The documentation resource is a file that contains documentation for the connector, such as a description of the external system's API.
      Returns:
      Path to the documentation resource
